properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The City Of Swift Current Along With The Water Security Agency
properties.Summary:
Description: The City of Swift Current wishes to advise property owners and residence that the water security agency has issued a precautionary drinking water advisory to properties located in Highland and Trail Subdivisions. This advisory is in affect until further notice.
Expires: 2019-05-20T00:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2019-05-14T17:35:07-06:00, B8107EBB-29E5-14E5-4BBE-EE8760C4B24F
Area: City of Swift Current
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An arctic ridge of high pressure building over NWT is creating strong winds near the Richardson Mountains. East winds of 60 km/h gusting to 80 today will increase to 80 gusting to 100 late tonight. These winds will persist through Thursday and likely into Friday morning. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-16T03:43:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-15T11:44:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1179680649.2019
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An area of fog remains in the region and is expected to persist until later this morning. ### Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-15T15:59:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-15T08:34:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2549956629.2019
Area: Kugaaruk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wreckhouse Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds are expected or occurring. Strong easterly winds with gusts up to 110 km/h will develop by noon. These winds are expected to diminish below warning criteria this evening. ### Wreckhouse wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-05-16T01:59:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-15T13:18:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3857008626.2019
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 20 cm is expected. Snow continues to fall this evening at Rankin Inlet and Whale Cove. The snow will taper off overnight. Storm total snowfall accumulations of 10 to 20 cm are expected. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-15T17:10:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-15T02:04:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2808909585.2019
Area: Rankin Region including Whale Cove
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Les Suêtes Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Very strong wind gusts that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Les Suetes winds gusting up to 140 km/h will persist until near noon today. ### Drivers may lose control of their vehicles; tall vehicles are at high risk of being overturned. Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Les Suêtes wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-15T17:59:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-15T14:49:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0673117271.2019
Area: Inverness County - Mabou and north
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clearing skies will allow temperatures to fall to the freezing mark overnight tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-16T06:41:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-15T14:42:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3813798704.2019
Area: Midland - Coldwater - Orr Lake, Orillia - Lagoon City - Washago, Barrie - Collingwood - Hillsdale, South River - Burk's Falls, Bayfield Inlet - Dunchurch, Deep River - Whitney - Eastern Algonquin Park, Western Algonquin Park - Lake of Two Rivers, Huntsville - Baysville, Town of Parry Sound - Rosseau - Killbear Park, Port Carling - Port Severn, Bracebridge - Gravenhurst, Oxtongue Lake - Fort Irwin - Northern Haliburton County, Haliburton - Minden - Southern Haliburton County, Bancroft - Hastings Highlands - Denbigh, Fenelon Falls - Balsam Lake Park - Northern Kawartha Lakes, Apsley - Woodview - Northern Peterborough County, Barry's Bay - Killaloe, Owen Sound - Blue Mountains - Northern Grey County, Hanover - Dundalk - Southern Grey County, Mount Forest - Arthur - Northern Wellington County, Innisfil - New Tecumseth - Angus, Shelburne - Mansfield - Northern Dufferin County, Orangeville - Grand Valley - Southern Dufferin County

properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clearing skies and light winds will allow temperatures to fall to the freezing mark early this morning. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Accumulating snow expected tonight. A trough of low pressure approaching from the south will spread precipitation across Newfoundland today. Over central Newfoundland, the precipitation will begin as rain late this afternoon or early this evening then change to snow. Snowfall accumulation of 5 to 10 centimetres is possible in some areas before the snow changes back to showers or drizzle by Thursday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-05-15T21:11:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-15T13:12:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2810480799.2019
Area: Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada
